jhave.server
Class ClientConnection

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      jhave.server.ClientConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, jhave.core.TransactionCodes
Direct Known Subclasses:
UWOSHClientConnection
public abstract class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Thread
implements jhave.core.TransactionCodes

The thread for a single client connected to the server. Every client connection is entirely represented by a ClientConnection object. When a client connects to the server, a new ClientConnection is created, and when the client disconnects, the ClientConnection for that user is destroyed.

Author:
JRE

parseCommand

public void parseCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
                  throws InvalidCommandException
Parses a String containing a command and takes appropriate action (i.e., executes the command specified in the String). Valid commands are documented in the file commprot.java. Each command is a String containing single-word tokens each separated by whitespace. The first token is always a number indicating the type of message being sent. The rest of the tokens, if any, depend on what numeric token the message begins with.

Parameters:
cmd - The String containing the command to be parsed.
Throws:
java.lang.InvalidCommandException - if the cmd is unrecognized or has bad parameters.
InvalidCommandException

cmd_instructorLogin

protected void cmd_instructorLogin(java.util.StringTokenizer namePass)
Login instructor. Sends back 600 to client if login successfull or 601 if login fail.

Parameters:
namePass - a stringTokenizer containing the instructor's name and password
See Also:
DBTransaction.instructorLogin

cmd_getAnswerAndVisualType

protected void cmd_getAnswerAndVisualType(java.util.StringTokenizer studentQuiz)
Get the quiz URL, student answer, unique id, number of questions, number of questions answered correctly and visualization type of the quiz that was taken by the student (Quiz name and student's user name are sent by the client) Send back to client 900 if succeed or 901 if fails

Parameters:
studentQuiz - a student tokenizer that contains the studen's user name, the quiz name, and the time the student started the quiz. Use '@' as token to retrieve the start time.
See Also:
DBTransaction.getAnswerAndVisualType

cmd_getQuizList

protected void cmd_getQuizList(java.util.StringTokenizer instructorStudent)
Create a list of quizzes for the instructor. Send back 800 if succeed or 801 if fails.

Parameters:
instructorStudent - a string tokenizer consists of the instructor's user name, or the instructor's user name and a student's user name
See Also:
DBTransaction.getQuizList

cmd_getStudentList

protected void cmd_getStudentList(java.util.StringTokenizer instructorQuiz)
Create a list of students for the instructor. Send back 700 if succeed or 701 if fails.

Parameters:
instructorQuiz - a string tokenizer consists of the instructor's user name, or the instructor's user name and a quiz name
See Also:
DBTransaction.getStudentList
